reviews.sentence: Jacksonville Mariot excels in service. The Jacksonville Mariot offers a great location reasonable rates and excellent service. The staff is hands on and very much interested in helping where the need arises. While the property is due for some upgrading the service will overshadow any shortfall in trendines. Located in close proximity to restaurants and shopping it is a good bet for business travelers and for leisure stays.

DJC bodybuilding show. Checked into this hotel and a very friendly atmosphere. The front desk was so helpful and willing to help. Manager Kelsey was the best awesome smile always wanting to offer her assistance. Just off I95 so convenient and large rooms. In work towards remodeling in the rooms and floors and can not wait to see the new look. I have ask my team to look into using this hotel to be our host hotel for next year. Seeing Kelsey there added to making this a easy offer to leave the Radison.

This hotel needs an upgrade. As Platinum Gold members we stay at Mariot properties about 23rds of the time when on the road. That said in a decade of travel we have never checked in and checked out within an hour at any hotel. The first impression was that maintenance to the parking and exterior facade had deteriorated since our last stay but this is often unavoidable after a Florida summer. What was unusual were the overflowing trash cans at the entry and pool areas moldy towels under sparse furnishing around the indoor pool and the odor of decay. The standard room had none of the amenities we have come to expect from Mariot refrigerator work space desk chair or seating area often a microwave. The desk clerk informed me that an upgrade was available if we wanted to pay for it. When reminded of the loyalty program promise for best available she suddenly discovered there were no better rooms for an upgrade and that we had already been given their best available because the room assigned was on the 8th floor of 9 with the concierge lounge closed for the weekend. I asked for the managers card so I could talk to him her but she could not find one though I did find a welcome letter on the counter with no contact information. On leaving the hotel there was no apology no offer of follow up or suggestion of further contact with any supervisor. I realize this is an older facility and I am certain that the management has been trying to hold it together during its slow decline over the years we have worked in JAX but it certainly appeared to me at least on this stay that it was well on the way to disenfranchisement. Fortunately there were rooms available at the Baymeadows Residence Inn about a mile or so away where we found a well maintained and managed property that interestingly is an even older Mariot facility.

Avoid. Old dingy rooms beds. Poor AC sheets stick to you. Very humid. I am a loyal platinum Mariot member. Used to the older properties. This one is all that and a step lower. Desperate need of updating. Staff incredibly warm and accommodating. Just a flat out sub standard property. Waste of my points sadly.

Nice staff. Rooms need an update. Nice staff. Rooms need an update. The Jacksonville Mariot is an older Mariot property not too far from I95 and 295. Parking is free. The lobby was clean bright and inviting. Lobby was decorated for the holiday which was a nice touch. Front desk staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Check in was seamless the way it should be. Gym was average sized. Equipment was in good working condition. However there were issues with the TV audio not working on the treadmill. Resorted to listening to audio from the wall mounted TV behind me. However there was music being piped in from an overhead speaker that I could not turn off which was annoying. Pool was small but clean warm and inviting. Since Platinum Lounge was closed for the weekend we used our breakfast voucher in the restaurant. The lady running the show in there was very friendly could n’t do enough for us. We had a great breakfast. Our room was just ok. It was well worn and everything was pretty dated. Definitely needs a major renovation. A C was on the warm side which was bothersome as it was a record hot December. We would likely stay again if our travels bring us back to Jacksonville. 3 stars with the staff being 4 stars.

Nice staff. Rooms need an update. Nice staff. Rooms need an update. The Jacksonville Mariot is an older Mariot property not too far from I95 and 295. Parking is free. The lobby was clean bright and inviting. Lobby was decorated for the holiday which was a nice touch. Front desk staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Check in was seamless the way it should be. Gym was average sized. Equipment was in good working condition. However there were issues with the TV audio not working on the treadmill. Resorted to listening to audio from the wall mounted TV behind me. However there was music being piped in from an overhead speaker that I could not turn off which was annoying. Pool was small but clean warm and inviting. Since Platinum Lounge was closed for the weekend we used our breakfast voucher in the restaurant. The lady running the show in there was very friendly could n’t do enough for us. We had a great breakfast. Our room was just ok. It was well worn and everything was pretty dated. Definitely needs a major renovation. A C was on the warm side which was bothersome as it was a record hot December. We would likely stay again if our travels bring us back to Jacksonville. 3 stars with the staff being 4 stars.

Rooms in need of a remodel. My family stopped here for the night on the long drive back to SW Florida. The lobby and restaurant were nice and the staff was very pleasant. The room was average but slightly musty. Everything was clean but worn out defiantly ready for an update.

Average. Room was okay. The reviews are correct it is a tired Mariot in need of an update but our room was clean. We ordered room service which was slow but the food was always hot and delicious. I would stay here again. I close my eyes and everything looks the same.

In need of a MAJOR overhaul. Rooms are dated rusty hinges peeling plaster old showers water smells like sulphur elevators slow bar is poorly stocked and ceiling over bar looked like sewerage leaked on it. Gut it and start over.

Good Service with older property. This property is a bit older but I think they recently renovated. The hotel is always very reasonably priced and the service is quite good. it is right off the interstate 95 so it is a good spot to stop for the night. They also have an indoor pool and is very close to a Dave and Busters if you are looking for something to do on your stop over. The most recent visit I requested a double bed in my reservation but due to the hotel being booked out they ran out of double beds. Chris at the hotel front desk offered to give me a complimentary roll away bed to acomodate for the oversight. I thought that was very proactive on his part to solve the problem. As a platinum member this kind of thoughfulnes makes me feel like a valued member.

Great stay. This traditional Mariot hotel is conveniently located off I95 in a corporate park south of downtown making it ideal for overnight southbound travelers as well as those on business stays. The hotel features complimentary on site parking a great savings over typical the typical hotel valet parking fees. This is an older property that has been renovated. The premises are immaculate. We were granted a complementary upgrade to a concierge level one bedroom suite in recognition of our Mariot Rewards member status. Our suite was spacious quiet and comfortable with a separate bedroom bathroom living area and kitchen with microwave and mini fridge and in suite coffee maker. There were flatscren internet TVs in the living area and bedroom. The bathroom had a walk in shower featuring an overhead rainfall shower head and handheld unit with good water pressure and ample good quality towels. There was a separate vanity area with upgraded toiletries. The king bed had an extremely comfortable pillow top mattress with good quality bedding and pillows. There was central AC rather than noisy wall units with separate thermostats for the living area and bedroom. As Mariot members we had access to free WiFi in our room complementary in the lobby and public areas to all guests. The hotel is not located within walking distance to any restaurants or shopping however there is on site dining at Bistro 202 where we enjoyed a delicious dinner. If you prefer to go out to dinner there are a number of restaurants at St Johns Town Center which is about 12 minutes from the hotel by car. We took advantage of the Concierge Lounge access for the cocktail hour hors doeuvres and beverages complementary for non alcoholic and cocktails for a fee and the buffet breakfast which was excellent and attended by a very gracious and capable hostess. We enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to return to this hotel. The staff is welcoming accommodating and professional. Everyone we encountered put forth an effort to make us feel comfortable and welcome.

Great Service Modern Property. We rented multiple rooms this stay and challenged the staff with numerous requests for each room. Ashley and Brittany handled each request with a smile. True professionals. The rooms were spacious and modern but could use an update. The gym is adequate but small as is the indoor pool. The lobby common are is small. The reason for the fifth star is the service not the facility which for a full service Mariot is only average. we had stay again and will in a month because of the service.

Fantastic staff at this clean Mariot. Plenty of free parking. Rooms and hallways and lobby are immaculate. All front desk staff friendly and helpful. Hotel right off I95Roms renovated but rather plain. Safe area of town. QuietSugestions 1. Add Kuerig coffee machine to room 2. Have real coffee mugs not wax covered to go only3. Upgrade TV to new flatscren 4. Add auto set clocks5. Recliner chair for comfort 6. Have a charger plug or a plug in bedside table lamp7. Concierge level has good breakfast selection and staff is attentive and super friendly add Chobani yogurt pleaseExtend breakfast until 1030 am8. Provide larger shampo conditioner Or use dispensers in showers9. No sign of recycling. Does this Mariot recycle10. Provide better room upgrades for Platinum EliteOnly there overnight so no use of pool gym etc.

Guest room renovation. The hotel is renovating the guest rooms and they are beautiful. Open spaces and lots of outlets on the nightstand. Lots of room in the bathroom door opens closes without bumping into you. Nice fitness center and complimentary self parking.

Guest room renovation. The hotel is renovating the guest rooms and they are beautiful. Open spaces and lots of outlets on the nightstand. Lots of room in the bathroom door opens closes without bumping into you. Nice fitness center and complimentary self parking.

Property crying for a makeover. The only reason I did not rate this a 2 or lower is because of the staff. Amy at the bar is pleasant and attentive. The ladies up at the lounge are on top of the busy breakfast hour keeping things stocked and greeting guests. That is where the positives end. Stayed here for two weeks in a row so far on business with my team. Upon entering any bedroom you are hit with a faint musty smell that has hints of dampness. Bring your slippers. The first week one day the hot water went out just in time for everyones morning shower. While this was fixed every shower after was lukewarm at best. The 2nd week it was a little better maybe it was because I was on a lower floor this time. but I would get about 5 min of concentrated hot water before it went lukewarm again. The elevators are painfully slow getting up to the 9th concierge becomes an extra 10 min ordeal especially during peak hours. One was out of service one of the weeks. I am Mariot Platinum lifetime so I have stayed at my share of Mariots. This one is way overdue for a renovation the bar needs to look more inviting although Amy does her best. the rooms need that Mariot updated modern touch the lounge needs to be expanded or reconfigured to accommodate the of people seating spread of food. and of course the other maintenance mentioned earlier. Have reached out to Mariot corporate who contacted hotel management but no reply thus far. we will be switching back to the Courtyard down the road and cancelling our RSVPs. The Aloft is the best hotel in the area with its modern feel lively bar and great use of space but since I am a Mariot loyalist I will head over to the Courtyard and have my drinks at the Aloft.

Family trip renovation needed. The service was friendly but the hotel overall is in a major need of an upgrade. The rooms feel like you are staying in a time warp from the 80s. I would not come back. Free parking out frontindoroutdor pool nothing pretty.

Awesome one night stay. We will be back. Pit stop for us here for the first time. We were driving to South Florida and have to rest for the night. Read a few reviews on TA and some state it needed a face lift badly. So we gave it a try because we wanted a full service Mariot. restaurant. There were plenty of other Mariot Hotels in the immediate area but we choose this place. As Platinum premier members with PLENTY of points this place is nice roomy and nice peasant service. Convienant and right off I95 plenty of free parking nice upgrade to the lounge level floor which was awesome. From the two front desk ladies who checked us in to the bartender Amy and Molase spelling. Sorry food and bev manager nice conversation with both. Good food at the bar. Our room was just awesome. Spacious clean comfy bed walk in shower with great water pressure with a living room and a counter bar area with a small fridge. It looks like the rooms on the lounge level was renovated first. We will be back. Safe travels.

can not believe the price for what I got. ☹. Staff was very friendly. The reason I chose this hotel was because it was supposed to have been a little chilly last weekend and there was an indoor pool. However would have been great if it was heated. Room 632. I was assured by Tahira at check in that I was going to LOVE my room because it had just been remodeled. I think that room got skipped in the remodel process. The mirror doors are so old it had age spots where the silver had worn off the back. Wear spots on the bed skirt which was dusty and the red chair was quite worn as well. The room was dirty I thought. Hair on the bathroom floor and in the tub drain. The sink vanity area floor was dirty the remote control was sticky and one of the glasses had lipstick on it. Found a red solo cup under the bed when doing a final search to make sure we did not forget anything. Also thought it was odd that the trash cans and ice bucket did not have liners. Additionally when I made the reservation the option was not there to have 2 people the first night and 4 the second night. As the breakfast was built into the room rate I explained at check in this was happening. I also explained that I would only need 1 breakfast the first morning and only 2 on the second morning. My room rate did not change for either of these situations.

Not The Best. The hotel is under a much needed renovation. My room smelled like paint. The showers have been renovated and it looks nice. I am a platinum member but was not offered an upgrade. Also there is a charge to use the computers in the business center. The charge is per minute. I was shocked by this. I have stayed in hotels Mariot Hilton etc. throughout the US and I have never had to pay to use the computers. When I complained to the front desk the lady said that is a third party and it is very expensive. She said that one person a few days before had been charged 290 for only a few minutes of use. This is shocking. Also upon arrival as a platinum member welcome gift I was offered either a 10 credit or 10 points. I chose the 10 points. I stayed on November 28 2018. As of today December 21 I have yet to receive my 10 points. The morning shift in the concierge lounge is very friendly.

Very nice hotel nice lounge excellent staff. This hotel is one of the nicer Mariots in the Jacksonville area and is quite centrally located to everything. Not downtown but close enough. The staff was wonderful there for pretty much everything you had want the room was well appointed crisp sheets and clean towels. The hotel could use a refresh probably getting to that time but the executive lounge is nice with a very nice staff and overall it is a very good hotel.
Needs work. The only thing that is been renovated so far is the bathroom.

Great Stay. Excellent experience. I chose this hotel even though it was going through renovations and was pleasantly surprised. My gf and I were given a newly renovated room on the 3rd floor. Check in was quick and painless. The room which included a king sized bed was beautiful. Room also had a small sectional sofa by the window which was definitely an added plus and a huge TV. Great room for the price and I will definitely be back.

First time staying here and I would definitely stay again. Everything was nice and clean and the staff was very polite. We even asked for a later checkout and they are more than generous to give us some extra time. Not sure what the rooms looked like before the remodel but they are excellent now.

Great place. Older hotel but renovations are improving it. Nice modern rooms. Grounds well taken care of. All of the staff are great. Even though the restaurant was being renovated they still accommodated one in the ball room. Comfy beds. Would go back in a heartbeat.

we have stayed at this hotel on numerous occasions this year will probably be our last stay there. the hotel was very noisy with people yelling and screaming in the middle of the night outside and on our floor was not a relaxing stay. the rooms have been updated and a nice shower installed however the shower doors are showing water stains that should be removed by housekeeping. the restaurant and bar are in the midst of remodel and instead were in a banquet room that did not have any ambiance waitress the night we arrived was very good and the food was great not as good for breakfast the following morning.

Poor. This stay was not what i would of expected from a Mariot. Me and my wife stayed here before and did not experience this on my last visit. They were remodeling but the rooms should have been cleaned and the sheets should have been clean daily.
Did not get full Mariot experience for the price. The rooms were spacious. For price the hotel was being renovated and did have free continental breakfast.
They are remodeling and is a little awkward. I hope they finish soon because location and structure is good.

Nice Renovation. Nicely renovated property Note. the renovation is still a work on progress pool is n’t finished nor is the lobby. The rooms are updated and they ’re nice. Stylish and functional. Lots of outlets on the nightstands are a nice touch.
If you have not been here since the 20 million dollar renovation you need to check out out. Absolutely outstanding. Congratulations to Tom and Mary. You guys crushed it at the Grand Reveal.
